iOvuad0mueDsQTuurke6AA.text: Small, friendly, ramen shop with unlimited free green tea and delicsious tonkatsu ramen. The broth is rich and smooth, the chashu tasty, and the noodles firm and fresh.  Highly recommended.

4nZbxiIep-z3XdgOnP-Iyw.text: Visiting Edinburgh from NYC for work, the singular meal I've missed most is (good) ramen. So happy that Edinburgh now has a contender - delicious!

SHRmdg4tfyrhmRfMydWDgQ.text: Cute little place which screams authenticity!  At 3.80 the ramen portions are small, but there is free green tea available, a variety of individually wrapped sushi options and fast service. So far I have had both vegetarian ramen options-the hell (which is super spicy, even for my crazily spice tolerance) and the miso. My friend took some sashimi with edamame beans and enjoyed it. The sushi on offer looked fresh and inviting.   The space is cute but relatively small. More of a place for a speedy lunch.   Upon leaving the chef took a photo of me with a polaroid camera and stuck said photo on the wall.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegetarian hell ramen

EofY2SebqrQc38N26jAnMA.text: Great food and nice service!  I would like to know if you have gift certificate service for us to refer our friends to try out your chef special at Maki and Maki.  Very pleased customers from Dallas, Texas who visited Maki and Maki on October 4, 2016.  If possible, please provide your email address so we can contact the owner directly .

p1HQNhVglfn8npEPS4vt8g.text: I will say the first time I came here after it first opened, I was no impressed. I cam again cause ramen cravings and I knew the food was good. But this time I was pleasantly surprised and had a fantastic experience.   So the atmosphere. It is tiny! But at the same time it feels like a ramen bar with the bar stools and eating against the walls. It's cozy, cute, and allows for creativity. YEah you can post on the walls and draw and whatever comes to you in the moment.   The food. It's really good. Ramen and maki is usually misnamed given that there's not much maki and sometimes no sushi. But ramen it does have and it is good. I appreciate how you can have a half size or a full size depending on how hungry you are. The full size is like a nice bowl size of ramen to fill you up. By the way they have a Hell's Fire Ramen and its super good in flavour and spicy is a nice level of heat and burn and delciousness. Be wary, it builds up. But don't worry the miso ramen is a great way to cool down the taste buds.  Vegetarian? Vegan? Don't worry they have tasty options for you! Most of their ramen can be vegetarian or vegan so no need to fret!

jyU4fGsh-i5LDONgCjYdeA.text: The "burnt soba" ramen was so good! I burnt my tongue slurping noodles because I just couldn't wait for it to cool down.

_Hh9eLLKOFLLyJD_YQpJTA.text: This place was pretty delicious. Service was spotty but food was spot on. Dumplings were handmade, the spicy ramen was flavorful but not too spicy. Two levels of seating upstairs and downstairs (maybe 24 people max). Walkable from Royal Mile.

0yCFD8QghHyvbSL_x9aoJQ.text: We stopped in to get some sushi, yet ended up eating the ramen and was definitely not disappointed. The ramen was excellent and a very welcomed meal after a long road trip. We left feeling nourished and fulfilled. Plus, they have free wifi!

rB2asvf4QKn9GAt7S4RAAw.text: The Richmond st location service was pretty horrible. We ordered the chefs bowl "burnt shoyu", dan dan mein ramen, and the green dragon sushi set. Our server only brought out one ramen bowl, gave us the wrong sushi set 20min later, and forgot about the dan dan ramen so that came another 10min later. Unattentative and no utensils or even water for our seats. Service alone I'd give it 0 stars. As for ramen itself, the chefs bowl was pretty decent. Chasu was good, noodles were a bit too soft for my taste, but broth wasn't too salty. Dan dan ramen wasn't bitter as one reviewer posted, actually more on the creamy sweet side. Still not bad, just different. The sushi on the other hand was definitely worth getting. It came from the main road location though as they have an employee ferry orders back and forth for sushi. Not a big deal, but if you want better service I'd say go to the one right near the intersection on Nicolson street, which may only have sushi, but they will probably ferry over the ramen if it's on their menu. At the least your server may be better than ours

XeQdKth0eQy3imSRBcvcBg.text: This place is good times. Definitely the closest Ive seen to an actual Japanese ramen bar in the UK and the best ramen in Edinburgh. Cute place and the people who work there are usually pretty helpful.

IsW-S3L0CMqpPkyNDNA28A.text: My craving of ramen is fulfilled. It tasted so good. The broth is thick and delicious. The place is small but cozy. The staff is very friendly as well. You can have free flowing hot green tea and water.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

DwIksQovpj4aVWXjB4WbeQ.text: Newly opened, spied this place on my way past last Thursday! Popped in for lunch, small menu of Ramen (special opening price of 2.80) with vegetarian options. Sushi is presented on the right as you walk in, trays underneath to collect your sushi. Green tea is placed at the bench style tables with condiments. The sushi was beautifully made and presented individually wrapped and is obviously very fresh. The ramen was very filling and tasty. Staff were very polite and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tonkatsu Ramen.
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

eG85BZiMeM5VRm7GfiKv6w.text: I've been walking past here when it was being renovated and have been waiting for ages to go for a visit. It was a very cute and efficient use of the small space. We were invited to help ourselvea to the sushi on offer and take them with us up to the till when we were ready to order. We had the salmon nigiri and the dragon roll, both were very delicious. I am a massive fan of soup noodles and was very excited for my tonkatsu ramen. The broth was delicious, though I could have done with a bit more meat in my portion. The staff were very friendly, he took a picture of us in the end to put on the wall with a small message. I really enjoyed the visit, and due to its affordable price, I am more than happy to go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The gyoza
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The tonkatsu ramen

8A72NlTSnirBJRMHyEo5cg.text: Authentic Japanese food at a good price. Small Cozy location, good service, I will be back..

NVgK8g7MGWjtP2qQ33IQWg.text: We thought Maki & Ramen was so good the first time we went that we decided to go there again the last day of our 5 day trip to Edinburgh.  1st trip: We came for dinner on a weekend and snagged the last couple of seats along the wall. The server chick was very friendly & we ordered tonkotsu ramen with a side of skewered pork yakitori. The ramen was incredible, the soft boiled egg was cooked perfectly, and the yakitori was flavorful and tender. While we were there we saw one of the chefs flame cooking something and the server told us it was another type of ramen (sorry I forgot the name, it might have been called burnt soy?) so we decided to come back and try that one next time.  2nd trip: we came for lunch on a weekday and noticed the entire staff was different than last time. This time we were offered complimentary green tea (last time we weren't) and I ordered the tonkotsu ramen again with egg and my husband got the flame finished ramen whose name I forgot. This time that ramen didn't get the flame treatment though disappointingly (booooo) and it turned out that it was pretty greasy. Maybe the flame thing makes it less so. My ramen was tasty though yet again although the egg was undercooked and some of the egg white was still runny (gross). There were also college kids at the table near us watching Japanese game shows on their phones at full volume. That killed the ambiance a bit.   All in all I'd say it is a great place to try while in Edinburgh, although there could be more consistency. I'd go again if I was in the area, and it is walkable from the royal mile.

184t9pSHagaT4ygWRGYx0w.text: An excellent wee place that I have walked past a few times. Needed to pick up something for lunch and I was not disappointed.  First of all it is a great layout and has a fantastic look. The sushi sits right at the door and looks a treat even if you just peer in the window. And while I ordered to go the staff were super friendly and we talked over a couple of the free green teas while my food was being prepared.  My meal to go was a tiny feast: pumpkin croquettes, gyoza, prawn and salmon sushi, dan dan mein and yakitori teriyaki chicken. It came to about 15 and every thing was perfectly portioned except maybe the yakitori, could easily eat 5 of them!   Over all it was fast, fresh and filling. Just what a lunch should be. Will definitely be returning.

8weMbecsipIHiywgvLO0tw.text: Really enjoyed the heaping portion of Spicy ramen, the delicious coconut icecream, and the huge carafes of green tea at the table.   There is ample seating upstairs for singles, and tables downstairs for groups.  A good spot for a ramen fix while in Scotland.

_Bfwca8ioNh_XgacfcI4Cw.text: We're followed the directions on the little hand written sign in the window of Maki Maki,  to a tiny place on Richmond St. The place was empty and we stood outside deciding whether or not to enter, when a young man who turned out to be a waiter for the restaurant, beckoned us in. The food is very good he said, I was a little skeptical; if it's good, why is the restaurant empty I thought? Within 5 minutes of sitting down, the place was full. Gabriel our waiter was quick, attentive and helpful. The food was delicious, affordable, and the portions generous. We'll be back! Definitely recommend!

IOCXyAuKVOynpSeVLEyLFA.text: Delicious! I dropped in here with a few friends because they were raving about it and it did not disappoint. I got the chicken curry box, as I was not looking for anything too big. To my surprise, it was rather big! Definitely got me full, but it was so good that I could go for another helping! My friends all said the Raman is fantastic, especially the chicken Raman. They also provide free tea, which is a great little addition! Next time I drop in here I'll be trying the chicken Raman and one of the sushi rolls! Highly recommend this place.

Hao2V6cH4C5iyFF1ZM4fig.text: Went here for an early Sunday evening meal and would recommend booking ahead, which I did via FB pm, they responded really promptly even when we had to change times. Really nice atmosphere that is reminiscent of small ramen bars in Japan (so I was told). The menu looks different to previous reviews and I didn't see an option for half bowls or free green tea, but the waitress came over with water without having to ask, which is a nice touch. We ordered octopus balls and salmon sushi set to share, really lovely salmon, and the tonkotsu and chilli ramen bowls. Both were gorgeous, noodles cooked amazingly as was the pork belly. Chilli ramen is pretty spicy so beware, but there was chilli oil on the table if you need to add. Good value. Can't wait to try more.

TCs4XSG4BbR9fDPQowpUDQ.text: This is okay ramen at its best. Pork belly is unflavorful. I also ordered spicy honey wings. The sauce is way too sugary, the wings stuck to the plate.

bPyc3HpQ5GapCbLiFzqy6Q.text: First of all let me say I really like the feel of this place. As a space it feels authentic to me compared with modern funky Japanese or Taiwanese restaurants I've been to in China. It has post it notes that people have written on, you eat at a bar shelf which skirts the wall (which is great if you're alone). Your implements are arranged in front of you and green tea is free.  The kitchen is open plan and you can see the chefs at work (not Japanese, if that makes a difference?) .  Sadly the bowl of tonkatsu ramen I got was not quite so good. Firstly it was a fairly stingy serving on all fronts  for the price (8 pounds)  The broth itself was fine but nothing miraculous. There was a single slab of pork on top and a lonely pair of green leaves floating nearby.  The noodles themselves were disappointingly like instant noodles. Larger bowls for more broth would be a big improvement.  Service was ok, friendly enough but not overly so. Go for the vibe and the ok food but if you've tried ramen in Japan or elsewhere lower your expectations. They also offer sushi.

A52iiWtSu5DXOWjT-WP39Q.text: We tried 2 ramen and 1 rice dish among several starts. All in all tasty and authentic. The portions are reasonable in size and the price is good.  Service is friendly and quick. There's a great atmosphere in the restaurant that reminded us of the little ramen shop we visited in our last Japan holiday.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

KMirWSlZ7NHI7XnMHxhXow.text: been twice. first time was great so we took some people there for dinner last night. everyone in our party was super sick to the stomach this morning. it was probably an isolated event, but with out a doubt it was from the ramen. everyone we went with had to stay home sick today.

Cb5JJiiIxpsBUrYzkbStCw.text: I really enjoyed the hell ramen at maki ramen! It totally satisfied my cravings for spicy ramen and the restaurant is really cozy and nice!

63iT_8Pizwfo61CeHe8mBQ.text: Small little restaurant not too far off the Royal Mile.  The homemade pork gyoza dumplings were phenomenal.  Also, tried the chicken ramen and added a soft boiled egg, which was also up to par.  Great meal for a chillier day.  There is not a lot of seating, so you might have to wait or be seated in the basement area, which has no windows and can create a slight feeling of claustrophobia given the small space.  Make sure you stake your claim before leaving the restaurant by doodling something on a sticky note or just signing it to add to the collection on the wall.  Good economical choice, and a great alternative to the ubiquitous Fish & Chips entree found everywhere in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Wall of fame made with sticky notes from visitors.
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken ramen with added soft-boiled egg.

SWRGaugQqosaCsqGW-xeZQ.text: Out with my friend and in the mood for something noodle-y.  After consulting my phone, we ended up here because it was one of the few places that was open, and it had the word Ramen in the title. So that fulfilled the basic criteria.   From the outside it looked like it could go either way. It doesn't exactly look like a place that has put huge amounts of effort or money into modern branding or decor. It's simple and feels quite home-made. It's a very small intimate room with a couple of long bars with tables along them. The menu consisted of bits of paper sellotape to a wooden chopping board. I was hoping that this was a sign that food was their top priority.   Thankfully the food was good. I had a very nice bowl of gyoza ramen. On a cold, rainy day, it was exactly what I wanted. At around 8 for the 'full size' portion it was a good size; I don't think I would have wanted anything smaller unless I had some other things to go with it. Green Tea was available for free which I don't drink it but my friend seemed to appreciate.  If you want to embrace your artistic side then post-it notes and pens sit above the bars, and the walls are plastered with little drawings and messages. It was a fun little diversion while we waited for our food and made it more memorable.  In the end I was charmed by this place and I definitely would like to come back and try some more food. It's small and quirky and quite fun with some good food. If I was a student I'd probably be in here a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu. Served on a board.
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sticky notes and pens provided for artistic types.
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gyoza Ramen

VRH1ZsI-BjDjX4hW9kXUKg.text: One of the few places you can get ramen in Edinburgh that has recently opened - though it is a small space (not for big groups!!).   Compared to ramen I've had elsewhere, the broth and noodles are very nice though the pork is a little too overcooked and too lean for my taste.   The place of course specialises in maki (sushi rolls) as well as ramen. But it turns out if you order sushi, it's made down the street in a place called Maki Maki (from the same owner) then hand carried down the street to be served to you in this restaurant! A bit odd and makes me wonder about its hygiene. But hey... Food is good!  Definitely a place to come back... If you can find a seat!

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tonkatsu Ramen
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bar seating for most of the restaurant

nzR8iFB8QjyHQk2uhV-ISQ.text: I loved this small but lovely place! This is the best Japanese restaurant I had in Edinburgh so far. You'll be able to find a range of ramen  and sushi/sashimi there. I ordered the salmon set, but the staff there made a mistake and gave me grilled set... But they were so nice that they made a new dish and gave me some of the shrimp in grilled set to me. The salmon set was actually pretty delicious! Very fresh and tasty. I loved that they put a tiny bit wasabi in the rice, which made the sushi much more tasty - and it's quite authentic way to made sushi, to be honest. In addition, the salmon set had about three salmon sashimi, two salmon sushi and four salmon & avocado sushi, and it only cost 8.8. I bet it would be way more expensive in any other Japanese restaurant for these things.  The atmosphere there was quite nice too. The posts and on the wall and fuji films reminds me of all other Japanese restaurant back in Shanghai.  One surprising but funny thing: we were provided with a menu in Chinese, but the staff there can actually understand what we ordered...haha

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salmon set

eQkeDvEk52mco0VPQc06FQ.text: Ramen was good but the service must be improved. Even if you can't sit us right away, it's always nice to say hello to the customers.  However, I really like the fact that there are many vegetarian options! The portions are huge and I appreciated that.

S1t-cTYqyRHOsqU8Vr2n2w.text: Very good! Almost vintage Ramen. Really affordable, especially half orders, plus the tea is free and refillable.  Small place but totally worth it for a fresh bite!  Enjoy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pork Ramon!  Very good!

hpN0WchPJqHqu_Eq_S7Owg.text: Cute hole in the wall off the main roads. You seat yourself bar-style upstairs, but there's additional seating downstairs. Water and green tea are free and self-serve. Ramen selection is decent -- not amazing (though I may be biased as I've had ramen all over the States before coming here) but pretty good. Egg doesn't come with the basic ramen so you'll have to add it on for another 1.50 in addition to the 8.95 the ramen costs, but my total still didn't break the bank. Service is friendly, if a little slow. A decent option for those in the Edinburgh area looking to get their ramen fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sticky notes that patrons can leave line the walls + menu
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Check comes in a cute little shopping cart!

ZSEbRS9iAadKl2xHTE7llg.text: I don't understand it's glowing reviews and my experience.    I ordered the chicken teriyaki ramen.  And the noodles weren't ramen noodles, they were regular noodles which were OVERCOOKED. (Cardinal sin for noodle makers).   There was no bite to it at all.    Any Asian worth their salt would've known this is below passing grade.    The soup, while not a complete loss had an artificial sweetness like from sugar which was just unpalatable.    Unfortunately, I find this place's high rating inexplicable.

ksNv8LwXC1n_afNWhV6usg.text: Thanks Yelp, for directing me towards a cheap but awesome ramen place! :) I brought my friends to this ramen spot to warm up after enjoying the outdoor Christmas festivities in Edinburgh!  First of all, the place is easy to find. It's tiny and pretty underrated looking but an awesome gem to discover!   It's small and cozy inside, and we were lucky to go in before it got super busy, so we managed to snatch 3 seats just for us.   We were very hungry since we were munching while walking about but we wanted to eat regardless, so the fact that they have half portion for only 4.50 made us SUPER happy!! Good job Maki & Ramen :)   I ordered the miso ramen broth and my friends had the beef one. We all added an egg with it which was an additional 1 I think.   My miso ramen was delicious! Very satisfying and flavourful. I absolutely love savoury broth during a cold day, so it really hit the spot for me! My friends loved their dishes too seeing as they slurped it up within minutes! And that egg though!! Soft and melty on the inside, hard boiled and well seasoned on the outside! Perfection!  The staff members were coohl too. Chilled out and in a good mood. I especially liked their music playlist because well, they played a lot of soundtracks from animes Hahahaha *enter geek mode*  Anyway, loved it! Cozy place, delicious ramen, cheap and nice staff!! Really really wish they had a branch in Glasgow cause I'd be there all day err'day son

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Yummy!!
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Comfy spot

Evv9xmvHwDh95a2paXzf2w.text: Deciding on where to go for dinner before going to the theatre was a bit of a challenge. I'm allergic to fish and the friend I was going with is vegetarian and gluten free, oh and was on crutches so couldn't walk too far or up or down stairs easily.   Maki and Ramen however managed to deal with all of our dietary (and time) requirements in a relaxed friendly manner. The seating upstairs is in the traditional sushi bar style with long counters and condiments on a rack. They also provide post it notes for you to doodle on and add to the very cute collection along the bar.   The menu is simple but provides a good variety of things. There is a good range of sushi and maki, six types of ramen and lots of side dishes including vegetarian gyoza. The sushi was freshly prepared to order and depending on where you sit you can watch it being made. Something that was being made while we were eating involved a blowtorch and unfortunately also fish or I would have asked what it was to order it next time.   The ramen was super tasty and a half portion was big enough to have with another side dish. The only minor thing was the noodles were a bit hard for my liking but it still was good.   Even though everything was prepared to order we had plenty of time to try the coconut ice cream moche, served with raspberry sauce. Yum!  The service was relaxed and it took a while to get the waiters attention at times but for a quick dinner it was great and only 30 for two of us including green tea and deserts. They only take cash (and need to put a bigger/more obvious sign up saying so) but there is a cash point at Tesco round the corner.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Coconut ice cream mochi with raspberry sauce
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tofu Ramen
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegetarian gyoza

Mxsqy7WJsUDZkottqNl7tw.text: THIS.   I have now finally experienced ramen as they should be served. Tasty, spicy and 'hot, hot, hot' After (well more during while) I tasted my Hot Pork belly Ramen with a soft boiled egg, I seriously considered moving in to the area as close as possible to this place. Just so I could have an excuse to be there every day.  Even when I cook myself I cannot make my ramen taste as wonderful as these chefs do it. There was no need to use any of the condiments, bar a little soya sauce. Just right.   The place is small, dinky. It resembles a Japanese street food 'corridor' with high bar stools. It seats around 10 people if pushed, but The food is swiftly served and, because it is so tasty, quickly devoured.  I don't know if they do take away, but I did see bento box offers too.  We had a fun time reading the menu, the post-it notes on the wall and we even had out picture taken for on the wall.   I'd be hard pressed to find anything remotely similar outside the streets of Japan!  Long may they stay where they are!

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Compliments and doodles
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Inside

tnOd6Vs7fmg8QBGCEd473g.text: Best ramen in Edinburgh!!!  Been to so many noodle bar, there are always a ramen option but most of them are just Chinese noodle with a MSG, water and soy sauce.  Guys, you def have to try out Maki and Ramen! a thick creamy broth that heal my body after I had it. (I'm serious) Smooth chewy Ramen, roasted half fat and half meat pork belly, fresh vegetable topping, roasted black sesame. The pork also melted in mouth mmmm!! I find my perfect Ramen!! In addition I order pork Gyoza, Tariyaki chicken. Oh and a Hell Ramen for my hot spicy wife. Btw, the hell ramen is not western spicy!!! So be warn.  They do sushi but have no chance to try that yet, but Maki will see me a lot. Extra points for service and atmosphere which I can't write anymore in one review.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sushi display

vEln_8wrYS7XFgoC8R6nnw.text: Been to most sushi restaurants in Edinburgh and would say this place is up there with the best. Great sushi very fresh great service. Would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

T3FDWpBbLSN9rmgpuBOIlw.text: Well isn't this place just as cute as a bug's ear!   A tiny little spot, all of maybe twelve seats on two bars. It feels a little like eating in a sardine can, but that somehow adds to the charm of it. There are post its all over the walls, the vibe is very laid back and though it is cash only, it makes up for it with being BYOB friendly. All in all, a good start to the evening.  With Caz H as my cohort in crime, we shared the grilled sushi and I had the vegetable gyoza and a half order of the Hell ramen. Now, i've been craving a great ramen place for a LONG while and Maki & Ramen gets pretty close to the mark. The broth was tasty and the pork belly in it was yummy, I just thought the noodles were a teensy bit overcooked. However, i'd happily take down another bowl in a heartbeat, so it really didn't sway me away from the dish.  I'd pass on the gyoza next time around but I really enjoyed the grilled sushi. All in all, i'm a little jealous this isn't closer to my house next time I need a ramen fix and if you're in the area, it's a good choice for a quick meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hell Ramen half portion
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Grilled sushi

CT9xqIVvkYXWGgQB2I7xBQ.text: I had a short stay in Edinburgh last month. This place is a hidden gem near the royal miles if you crave a bit of East Asian food especially Japanese ramen. It is located near university of Edinburgh so most of the customers are students and you can expect the price to be reasonable as well. Small but cozy. Good for one or a small group of people. Lots of ramen options. It is a good option especially when it is freezing outside.

GjQFQtbHG1rlRZxxCvp8YQ.text: I frikkin love ramen. Seriously I could eat it morning, noon and night. So it's no surprise that this place caught my eye when I was wandering up to Newington the other day.  This place is super small but super cute with bar seating for about 12. The server was relaxed and welcoming as I pulled up a swivel chair. The walls are decorated with post-it notes full of doodles and messages from previous customers. This is a really fun idea, it gives the place a personal feel and something to look at while you're waiting for your food!  On offer is good selection of traditional ramen as well Yakitori and sushi dishes. I go for the spicy beef ramen with a soft boiled egg. Coming in a just under 10 this is not too bad as far as Edinburgh prices go. The place is BYOB but they offer Japanese drinks and teas too. It is cash only.  My food comes quickly and I am very pleased. I want to dive it in but it is too hot! The broth is wonderfully spicy and flavourful. A healthy portion of medium rare beef tops the handmade noodles, sweetcorn and greens. My eggs is oozingly soft boiled. I am in ramen heaven and I finish every bit of it!  I'm definitely going to be back to sample the sushi and I want to try the pork belly ramen. Perfect on a cold Edinburgh day!  Cheers, A x

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Spicy beef ramen - made my nose run but very tasty!

1SwCnDDtvGgGl09UQ7C9Ug.text: First time in Edinburgh but I did have decent ramen before in other cities like New York and London. I really think the ramen is pretty good and the sushi rolls are decent too. Not mind blowing super delicious but I would recommend this place if you want to have some good legit sushi rolls and ramen.

bCx8eZHD75LvNqStvoSSiw.text: Everything here was amazing!!! From the sushi to the gyoza and tempura and the ramen taste just like Japan! The staff was so nice and friendly they'll leave s smile on your face and a smile in your belly!!  Definition a must go if in town and wanting good ramen!  Sorry for no pictures I was to hungry

n4WsUFY3KnjuF9th8xKr-Q.text: Incredible ramen shop very near to Old Town and University of Edinburgh. It can get busy but going right when they opened meant we were sure to get a spot. The shop is quite small on the top floor, with bar style seating and only 2 tables, however there are a few more tables downstairs to increase their capacity.   Staff were very nice, helpful, and funny. Free green tea and water waiting for you at every seat is a plus! They have a good number of ramen options including classics and some new twists. We ordered the Hell Ramen and Miso Ramen. The Hell Ramen was predictably quite spicy - but perfectly so, right at the point where it was difficult to eat but still enjoyable, with the spice a serious component but not drowning out the rich flavor. The pork was *perfectly* done, tender and delicious. This was 5/5 ramen.   Unfortunately, the Miso ramen was a big letdown. It was watery and unremarkable, and really didn't live up to it's potential. It's hard for miso ramen to stand up to a rich pork broth but this ramen didn't even try. 2/5.   Miso ramen issue aside, the experiance was overall nice and I would love to return and try some of the other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tan Tan Ramen
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beef Tataki Ramen - slightly spicy slightly creamy, generally very tasty! 4/5
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Miso Ramen

RXD-dzXXsZTNv_82hHfp4w.text: The ramen, gyoza, and edamame were solid, and the Hell Ramen was indeed spicy as advertised. Being sick and full didn't assist my experience, but I'd still come back if I lived in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hell Ramen

-SPnXVXBSsqriMsC7un1rw.text: Great little ramen shop just off of Nicholson Street. The staff is really helpful and the menu has a diverse offering of different types of ramen. There is free hot tea and definitely recommend adding extra noodles or an egg. Fast, convenient, and friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Bb6YbIiPiQQ1RmlbRjuTAw.text: So good! This was our first food stop in Scotland, and my first real ramen experience in general. I was pleasantly surprised about how good and filling it was, and so were my husband and friend. The customer service was very nice as well. I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Miso ramen

ngsgtAFFvq-tinadypNabQ.text: Had the black tonkotsu ramen. It was pretty good overall. I consider myself a ramen traditionalist so I may be a bit more critical than the average customer.  The pork slices were soft and flavorful but perhaps a bit too much on the anise seasoning. The noodles were firm and cooked well. The soup was just a tad too salty. It could have also been served at a slightly hotter temperature. The waitress was professional and service prompt.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Black Tonkotsu Ramen!

THvcQxTCpjzZOWwCA5-4QQ.text: Decent ramen. Really cool restaurant. The service was nice. This place is popping so expect a wait. The ramen was pretty bland however. I heard their sushi was good as is their gyoza. They have free water and hot tea which is really nice.

g5v1UWaoKyWrxmks57WMog.text: I had the black tonkotsu ramen. What I liked was that it's not too salty, but it wasn't really flavorful either. I was expecting a bit more, however I was satisfied as it was a chilly night and I could do some ramen. Good spot for a quick bowl of warm ramen!

FVN-69qJ0dja9BERqYrEkw.text: Absolutely amazing food! Best ramen I've ever had. Free WiFi, clean bathrooms, fast service. Everything you could ask for

kh2rFHk28dWdaDNDujn3Ow.text: This place is great! The chicken ramen was very tasty, the miso soup was good, and the hell ramen (which they made vegetarian for us!) was DELICIOUS! The staff was also very friendly and helpful with out questions about the city, since we are from out of town, and accommodating to dietary needs. We definetly recommend!

3wbpWYQuKnlrxzEzV3d0fw.text: I don't even know what I can add. This place has a lot of five star reviews and all of them are warranted. I was in Edinburgh for three nights - I managed to get to Maki and Ramen twice. I would have come more often had I found this place earlier in my trip!  The food was excellent! I had the salmon ramen each time and the fish was flavourful. The portions are huge, you certainly do get value for your money. The dining area is small, but there's more space downstairs. Do not let the tiny dining area put you off, this will likely be some of the best ramen you will ever have in your life.

x4sG4mmQY76zQA0bkYy8DA.text: Very nice staff, we arrived a bit late, around 30min before closing and ended up staying 30min after closing and never felt rushed. Our waiter, unfortunately I didn't catch his name, was very polite and attentive without hovering. Ramen was good, definitely get the kimchi to add in.

bvDgh2zWQ69S2I8Y9NW-uQ.text: Came in about 12ish pm on a Saturday afternoon and it was quite empty.  This is the second time I am here and here to try the other ramen they have to offer.    I ordered half a portion of Dan Dan mien.  I thought this was going to be soupless where in the chinese version it's a dry version.  Soup was light, flavourful and not too spicy like the hell ramen.  Again noodle was a little bit softer than I prefer it.  Toppings included vegetables and shredded chicken which went great with the noodles and broth.  I then ordered another half bowl of the miso ramen.  I think the miso flavour is there but I think it is under seasoned.  I had to add a bit of soya sauce just to pull out the maximum flavour.  This one can be skipped if you come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Jd9_nxkOaVYtnG6hyWbR2g.text: Good ramen and pan-fried dumplings, but it looks like the veggie dumplings aren't vegetarian and might contain some pieces of pork.

3Jc8tKlznqFaiEhzcQNLzQ.text: Ramen was outstanding! The broth was rich and the noodles were fresh.   Cozy enviroment and quick service. You won't be disappointed.

_dveaPYDgcPIoB7Zd5vwOw.text: YASSSS!  We actually spotted the sister restaurant Maki Maki on the main street after a trip to the Festival Theatre and went back there the following day. It was full so they sent us around the corner to Maki and Ramen and I'm soo happy we found this place.   It's been soo long since I've had a nice big, homely bowl of Ramen so I was really looking forward to getting stuck in.   It's a small, but perfectly formed restaurant that takes me back to my time in Japan. Stools and high tables along the side with a few booths for groups. Real canteen style. The wall paper was the neon signs of Tokyo.   Free water and Green tea and a great selection of other drinks at really reasonable prices.   Spicy miso and soy on the table which is so lovely to have as you'll pay for the spicy miso in most other places. The menu was just perfect for me! Ramens, Goyza, sashimi, sushi and even matcha icecream and mochi balls for desert for 1!!  I wish I could express in words how much I loved this place! But I did leave a message on a post-it note on the wall of restaurant like many other visitors.   We had the salmon broth (like ramen but with dashi base) with some octopus balls to start and kimchi salad (small portion of pickled cabbage). Yum! All of it was just soo yum and I was just soo happy to be there!   Really reasonable prices with starters/sides around 4-6. I wish I lived in this city as I'd be there all the time!   I highly recommend this place !!

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Octopus balls, kimchi salad... Spicey miso and free green tea. Yum
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salmon Broth... Om nom nom

ggOPiOxrJE-Sj8k6NEhIgg.text: Found this spot after a long cold day exploring Edinburgh and the ramen did not disappoint. Huge serving of food that was fairly well priced. We had to wait outside for around 20 mins before a table was ready but it was worth it. They were very busy and the service - although friendly- wasn't ideal with some of our dishes not getting to us until we asked a number of times. Definitely recommend on a less busy evening!

tEQSaudZcBkDaZnP4Ldm7A.text: Spicy tuna hosomaki but detected no spicy... then den den mein which was also supposed to have spice but was mild in my opinion. Still a lovely dinner and hit the spot, ramen noodles are fresh and homemade it is obvious. Would come back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

sqpZej3kWECvUbzMCUUDxw.text: The ramen here is pretty legit.  If you've been going to Wagamama desperate for a fix, only to be disappointed that one of the most important aspects of good ramen, that rich and deeply flavored stock, was replaced by a watery broth...  Come here instead!  My first visit was with my husband, who's probably an even bigger ramen fiend than I am. We've had some fantastic bowls in New York, Vegas (off the Strip there are amazing ramen places), Tokyo and we went in...managing our expectations because we weren't expecting a really good bowl to have made its way to Edinburgh just yet.  We both really enjoyed our meal and I love coming back.   The traditional tonkotsu ramen is done well here. The broth is very good quality. Richly and deeply flavoured, hearty. The chashu pork, egg and other additions well-made too. Noodles are slightly chewy and al dente as they often are in the best ramen.  The Master Chef Burnt Soyu has some strong flavours but I really enjoyed them. If you're a garlic lover this is ideal.   Another thing I loved finding on the menu were the octopus balls (takoyaki). They're a pretty common nibble in Tokyo but I haven't seen them as much in Japanese restaurants abroad and here they're really tasty, served in the standard style with a drizzle of eel sauce, mayo and a little shaved bonito flake fluttering on top.   Other side nibbles include kimchee and gyoza, which are decent.  The restaurant itself is small and informal, service is friendly and relaxed.   Seems pretty popular with students since it's close to the uni, but even if you're not a student it makes for a delicious and fun slurpfest of a meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hell ramen with soft boiled egg. Very spicy but delicious.
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Garlicky yummy soy ramen
Photo of Maki & Ramen - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tonkotsu ramen (asked for mine without sweetcorn)

hUs6UrsvAIdEAmOy_t5FNA.text: Best ramen I've had! And I was so surprised to find it in Scotland of all places. The Tonkotsu was incredible, and my husband had a bowl called chef's... something. I can't remember, but it may have been even better. Don't skip this place!
